Who Can Order Demonstrations?

Our lecture demonstrations are only available for the Department of Physics & Astronomy instructors, and for instructional purposes only. We do not provide support for research or other departments on campus.

How Do I Order Demonstrations?

Please email Noah Hinojos with a c.c. to Benjamin Avila the demo(s) you would like to order. We ask that you include the full alphanumeric ID and title of the demonstration in your email.

If you would to like to modify an existing demonstration, or have a new one in mind, let us know! We're more than happy to help you showcase whatever physics topic you have in mind.

When Should I Submit My Order?

Please submit your order 24 hours in advance to guarantee that it can be fullfilled. You may also send us your demonstration requests for the entire quarter ahead of time.

How Do I Receive The Order?

We will deliver the demonstration(s) to your classroom and set it up in the 10 minutes before class begins. We will pickup the demonstrations after class ends. In cases where there is a time conflict between two or more requests, we will let you know about the conflict and will deliver demonstrations according to the order in which requests are received.

How Do I Perform The Demonstrations?

If you're unsure how to perform a demonstration, we strongly reccomend you schedule a time with us in advance with us to practice. Feel free to email us with any questions or concerns.

You're also welcome to ask us to perform the demonstration during your class instead.
